comment.text: Carbohydrate degradation; glycolysis; D-glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate and glycerone phosphate from D-glucose: step 4/4.
Homotetramer. Interacts with BBS1, BBS2, BBS4 and BBS7.

disease.name: Hereditary fructose intolerance
disease.description: Autosomal recessive disease that results in an inability to metabolize fructose and related sugars. Complete exclusion of fructose results in dramatic recovery; however, if not treated properly, HFI subjects suffer episodes of hypoglycemia, general ill condition, and risk of death the remainder of life.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
In vertebrates, 3 forms of this ubiquitous glycolytic enzyme are found, aldolase A in muscle, aldolase B in liver and aldolase C in brain.
Belongs to the class I fructose-bisphosphate aldolase family.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology

property.value: P:fructose catabolic process to hydroxyacetone phosphate and glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate
P:vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex assembly

feature.description: Necessary for preference for fructose 1,6-bisphosphate over fructose 1-phosphate
In HFI; reduced enzymatic activity; dbSNP:rs41281039.
In HFI; affects proper folding; dbSNP:rs781023784.
In one subject with fructose intolerance; rare variant; America; dbSNP:rs118204430.
In HFI; 100-fold decrease in catalytic efficiency for substrates FBP and F1P; dbSNP:rs145078268.
In HFI; Turkey; 4800-fold decrease in catalytic efficiency for FBP and inactive with F1P; dbSNP:rs555935217.
In HFI; Turkey and South Europe; dbSNP:rs77718928.
In HFI; almost no effect on enzymatic activity at 30 degrees Celsius, but reduced activity at higher temperatures; dbSNP:rs369586696.
